content: victorian lace collar pattern by kristen orme abbreviations & links rs right side of work sl slip ws wrong side of work psso pass slipped st over k knit yo yarnover p purl tbl through back loop st/s stitch/es ssk slip slip knit link for tutorial repeat repeat k2tog knit 2 together link for tutorial patt pattern s2kp2 sl2 k1 p2sso link for tutorial pattern using 3 75 mm needles cast on 213 sts loosely commence chart 1 working row 1 with 3 75mm needles switch to 3 00mm needles for row 2 and the rest of the collar note row 1 is a ws purl row odd-numbered row are ws even-numbered row are rs the edge sts are working in stocking/stockinette st and will serve as seam allowance to be sewn into the garment alternatively for the stand-alone collar work this row as k2 p to the last 2 sts k2 this establishes a 2-st garter border on each side of the collar making a lovely and simple edging materials work row 1-12 of chart 1 there are 26 repeats within each row the 12th row is a decrease row in yarn 1 ball debbie bliss ecobaby fair trade collection which you decrease 2 sts per 8-st repeat 161 sts 125m/50g colour 14016 used commence chart 2 work row 1-10 of the chart there are 26 repeats within each row the 10th row is a decrease row in which you needles 3 75 mm for cast-on decrease 2 sts per 6-st repeat 109 3 00 mm for the rest sts gauge 24 sts and 30 row = 10 cm or 4 inches in chart 1 pattern pattern continues next page with 3mm needles exact gauge is not crucial but best to keep close to this gauge this collar can be knitted as an insert to the design for cloth magazine by cassandra belanger or alternative instructions have been provided to knit the collar to be worn separately as an accessory for the © kristen orme 2012 accessory option follow the italicised notes within the brackets www kristenorme com pattern cont commence chart 3 work row 1-7 of the chart there are 13 repeats within each row after the 7th row work a garter ridge as follows row 8 rs k all sts row 9 ws p3 k9 k2tog tbl to the last 4 sts k4 p3 row 10 k all sts cast-off in patt by purling the first 3 sts knitting the body sts and purling the last 3 sts while casting off finishing weave in ends to block gently spray collar with lukewarm water on a dry towel lay out collar stretching and pinning to spec requirements pictured right pin scallops into place apply gentle steam from iron as per yarn manufacturer instructions let collar dry completely alternatively… for more 3d shaping pin to towel wrapped around dummy s shoulders so that collar drapes and dries exactly to fit the body charts
